verses.roman:
uḍiyā eka strī bhīḍe darśana nā pāñā
garuḍe caḍi' dekhe prabhura skandhe pada diyā

synonyms: uḍiyā—a native of Orissa; eka—one; strī—woman; bhīḍe—in the crowd; darśana nā pāñā—being unable to see; garuḍe caḍi'-climbing up the column of Garuḍa; dekhe—sees; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; skandhe—on the shoulder; pada—her foot; diyā—placing.
translation: Suddenly, a woman from Orissa, unable to see Lord Jagannātha because of the crowd, climbed the column of Garuḍa, placing her foot on Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu's shoulder.
